title: Added ability to specify chords with explicit relationships instead of a matrix.
body:
Hi,

I wanted the ability to specify chord data with a simple

{
   source: 0,
   target: 2,
   value: 45,372
}

kind of relationship object.  This also allows explicit declaration of which is the source and which is the target.  (When using a matrix, whichever number is first, or larger, wins.)

I added two new methods to d3.layout.chord:

.relationships(x) 
- gets or sets the relationships array.

.addRelationship(sourceIndex, targetIndex, value)
- pushes an individual relationship onto the relationships array.

I then added code to that closure's relayout() function to use the relationships array to populate the chords and groups arrays.

I've got a sample reworking of the hair-color example chord with the correct dominant hair color highlighted.  I'm having git issues though, and am unable to push the new files.  Happy to send them offline on request.

Feedback is of course appreciated.

Cheers,
Dave

title: Add flag to zoom behavior to control zooming origin.
Update jsdom to v0.2.14.
body: We can finally re-enable those tests!

title: Minor simplification to number regex.
body: If `\d+\.?\d*` doesn't match, then there are no digits before the `.` so no need to match `\d*` in the alternative pattern.

title: Pull request for #565
body: Work in progress for #565

title: Line defined usage example
body: I've added an example for the usage of the `.defined` function, based on the `line` example. For the `data` input, I interspersed `null` values for `y`. When drawing `<circle>`s though, these `null`s don't come out very well, so I `filter`ed the data that comes in for the circle markers.

title: Remove a couple of stray globals.
Fix a bug when interpolating exponent notation.
body: We weren't properly detecting "1.e2" as a valid number.

title: Fix #434: chord groups returned in wrong order.
histogram: deal with the degenerate domain without throwing an exception.
d3.xhr: treat req.status === 0 as error.
body: This occurs during a failed cross-origin request, for example.

title: Ordinal scale inversion
body:
For use with d3.svg.brush e.g. for brushing histograms with ordinal scales.  This is a very simple implementation; ideally we want to take into account the current type of range in use.

If I'm headed in the right direction, I'd be happy to improve it and add tests. :)

title: In d3.behavior.drag, the initial mousedown event should be cancelled
body:
If you don't call preventDefault() on the mousedown event, the browser will select text on the page while you drag. For example, try dragging the circle over the text in this fiddle:
http://jsfiddle.net/M8uga/

This event was being cancelled in the previous version of d3.behavior.drag (before the rewrite), so I'm guessing it was just an oversight.

title: Sorting NaNs with d3.{ascending,descending}.
body:
Previously, this was happening:

``` javascript
[1, 5, NaN, 3, 2].sort(d3.ascending);
[1, 5, NaN, 2, 3]
```

Native sort ignores undefined values, so sorting [1, 5, undefined, 2, 3] worked as expected, but this change fixes d3.ascending and d3.descending for any orderable value, including undefined.

title: Fix background rect brush events for IE9.
body: I'm not sure pointer-events: all is necessary on the parent `<g>`, so I've removed it assuming it's sufficient on the background `<rect>`.

title: Add X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest header to xhr
body:
I'd like to add an `X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest` header to `d3.xhr`. I'm working with the Flask web application framework, so I figured this should be handy. From the Flask docs:

> [**is_xhr**](http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/api/#flask.Request.is_xhr)
> _True_ if the request was triggered via a JavaScript XMLHttpRequest. This only works with libraries that support the `X-Requested-With` header and set it to _XMLHttpRequest_. Libraries that do that are prototype, jQuery and Mochikit and probably some more.

title: Added sizzle to dependencies and index.js
body:
I was trying to use d3 as a node module and was running into problems with d3.select throwing a TypeError:

> require('d3').select('body');
> TypeError: Object [ null ] has no method 'querySelector'

Adding sizzle to the selectors and adding it as a global in index.js resolved the problem.

title:
added missing "

" tags to examples/albers/albers.html
body:
examples/albers/albers.html had some missing "p" tags;
this caused the sliders to display poorly.

title: fix typo on path
body: There's a missing "../../" on the `<script>` tag. This patch makes it consistent with the other examples (and makes the example work with a webserver running on d3/)

title: Use a subpath for closed area interpolation.
body:
This is more relevant for radial areas e.g. when using both stroke and fill simultaneously on the same paths in a stacked radial area.

Related: I've always wondered if it's worth adding line-closed even though it's trivial (just append "Z").  Perhaps this would be a reason to add this i.e. to force use of a subpath for radial areas when line-closed is in use?  Alternatively, we could have a dedicated open/closed/none option that appends "Z" for step-*, too, rather than having separate interpolators for each subtype.  I guess it doesn't really make sense for monotone though.

title: added stream chart example
body: The stream chart example has the same functionality as the current stream example. It uses a stream chart wrapper http://bl.ocks.org/1935509 that supports transitions on data updates.

title: additional colour space for d3
body:
Here is a patch for adding CIE Lab colourspace to d3.

There is a gist up http://bl.ocks.org/1958838 showing the improved perceptual colours for brighter and darker, will add some more for the hues.

title: Fixes #576: leap year bug in d3.time.format.
body: We need to set the date fields from year down, rather than in arbitrary order.

title: d3.layout.hierarchy: Allow internal nodes to have value
body:
This adds the ability for the internal nodes to contribute to their value, instead of their value being entirely composed of their children's values.

Adds a new method to d3.layout.hierarchy() to set `internal_value` in a similar fashion that you set the `value` for leaf nodes. When recursing, check to see if there's a function for internal_value, if there is, call it.

I am new to d3, so I apologize if this is already do-able, or if I left anything out.

title: Inheritance for transition.each.
body:
If you use d3.transition(selection) within the context of a transition.each, the
created transition will automatically inherit the delay, duration and easing of
the parent transition. Likewise, if you use d3.transition(selection) within the
context of a selection.each, it simply returns the passed-in selection with no
transition at all. This makes it easier to create components, such as the axis,
that support automatic transitions.

title: Add selection.multiply.
body:
This is similar to selection.each, except you get a single-element selection and
a transition function. This makes it easy to implement components that support
automatic transitions when called on selections, such as the axis and brush.

title: update to latest jsdom
body:
The update is to get the most recent version of contextify
which is a dependency of jsdom. Previous versions of 
contextify always generate a 64 library module. v0.6.11 of
node on macos is a 32-bit ARCH. The latest version of 
contextify  builds an ARCH that matches node NOT the arch
of the system.

See: https://github.com/brianmcd/contextify/issues/19
